conversation:
Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
Counsellor Florrick: Wyll - by the Maimed God, what's become of you?
Wyll: A story best left for calmer days. Now breathe deeply - are you in pain?
Counsellor Florrick: A scorched throat, a few hairs singed off. Nothing a bit of time and fresh air can't cure.
Counsellor Florrick: Fist Aelis, a new duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.
Counsellor Florrick: Report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Wyll: No, it can't be. You mean, they've taken -
Counsellor Florrick: Yes, Wyll. The drow have your father.
Player: Ravengard? I know that name.
Counsellor Florrick: As well you should. He is the great champion of the Council, commander of the Flaming Fist - the binding force holding Baldur's Gate together.
Counsellor Florrick: Without him, the city faces collapse. In fact, I fear that may have been the intention of those who abducted him.
Counsellor Florrick: Wyll, you must hold little love for your father. But please, find him and return him to the city.
Wyll: Trust us to see it through, Counsellor.
Counsellor Florrick: May I trust you'll see it through?
Player: The drow took the Duke to Moonrise Towers.
Counsellor Florrick: Moonrise Towers? Along the old road? That place is cursed. Few could survive there...
Counsellor Florrick: ... unless darker forces are at work.
Counsellor Florrick: This was no random attack. The Grand Duke was their target.
Player: You'll need to find him without my help - I've done all I can for now.

Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
Counsellor Florrick: Wyll, by the living gods! I couldn't have asked for a finer saviour.
Narrator: *She is a ghost from your past come to haunt you - Counsellor Florrick, your father's closest confidante, and a loyal servant of Baldur's Gate.*
Counsellor Florrick: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Pavel.
Counsellor Florrick: Now listen close, fist: duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.
Counsellor Florrick: Aelis - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Counsellor Florrick: Gauntlet - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Fist Recruit Pavel: On your command, Counsellor.
Counsellor Florrick: The rest of you - count the dead. Take word of their sacrifice to the city.
Counsellor Florrick: And you - I must ask again for your aid.
Counsellor Florrick: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.
Counsellor Florrick: May I trust you'll see it through?
Player: The Absolute's cult is based at Moonrise Towers. That's where they'll have taken the duke.
Counsellor Florrick: Moonrise Towers? Along the old road? That place is cursed. Few could survive there...
Counsellor Florrick: ... unless darker forces are at work.
Counsellor Florrick: This was no random attack. The Grand Duke was their target.
Player: You'll need to find him without my help - I've done all I can for now.

Sceleritas Fel: Master. You are the chosen one.
NodeContext: Awestruck
Sceleritas Fel: He is near... He comes for you.
NodeContext: Butler's body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge walks toward the pool of blood, peering down at the Avatar of Bhaal within
Bhaal Avatar: I expected the other.
Bhaal Avatar: But you live, and her blood is returned to me. You are my Chosen.
Bhaal Avatar: I have a gift for you, Child. You will use it to lacerate this world.
Narrator: *A gift from your god, your Father. An offering of his affection for you, or confirmation that he owns you.*
Narrator: *Accept Father's gift and you will reap horrors upon this world. But you will be his puppet. This is your final chance to cut your strings...*
GROUP_ORI_DU: Bow your head.
GROUP_ORI_DU: What gift does the Lord of Murder propose?
Bhaal Avatar: The Slayer form will be yours. Made crueller. Stronger. The prime incarnation of murder.
Narrator: *It seems impossible to stand against your Father. But you have fought this long against your nature - there might just be a way...*
Bhaal Avatar: My Slayer. You will grow stronger. Crueller. The prime incarnation of murder.
GROUP_ORI_DU: What would you have me do with this gift?
Bhaal Avatar: Domination. Slaughter. Mountains of corpses, you standing atop them.
Bhaal Avatar: You must destroy this world. It is what you were made for.
Narrator: *For a moment, the brine-pool of your brain clears. To die: to rest, to save the world from yourself. To accept: to become his prophet - in any disobedience, subject to his lash.*
GROUP_ORI_DU: I obey, Father. This world will be eviscerated.

Nightwarden Minthara: The goblins tell me that you extracted a confession from our prisoner, True Soul.
Nightwarden Minthara: Without your help, they would have extracted nothing but screams and blood.
Narrator: *Her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
Nightwarden Minthara: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.
Nightwarden Minthara: It is time for the raid to begin. The grove, and those who are hiding there, will fall.
Nightwarden Minthara: Go to their refuge and make your way inside. As a friend.
Player: They'll die thinking I'm their hero.
Nightwarden Minthara: Exquisite. The Absolute chose well when She chose you.
Nightwarden Minthara: I will gather a raiding party and move into position.
Nightwarden Minthara: You will open the gates from the inside when the time is right to strike.
Nightwarden Minthara: We will cleanse the place of infidels and burn it to the ground in the Absolute's name.
Nightwarden Minthara: And then we will be the first among Her favourites.
Narrator: *The masterful painting she depicts of the massacre awakens you hungrily.*
Player: I've done enough. The battle is yours to fight.
Nightwarden Minthara: I do not intend to lead a suicidal charge. The goblins are expendable; I am not.
Nightwarden Minthara: The Absolute brought you here for a reason - to throw open those gates so we can crush our enemies.
Player: If I do this, I expect to be rewarded.

Sazza: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.
Nightwarden Minthara: A drow? Tell me, Sazza, did your misadventures take you to the Underdark?
Sazza: They woz in some rickety druid grove! Mostly full of tieflin's, but them intruders you're after were hidin' out there!
Nightwarden Minthara: I presume you dealt with my prey, and massacred the rest?
Sazza: Ah... well, the thing about that is... they sorta massacred us.
Sazza: This mug helped me escape though. I say we stick a few holes in them... show how grateful we are.

Narrator: *You feel a cold hand caress your mind as the drow appraises you.*
Nightwarden Minthara: Oh dear. Your prisoner is one of the Absolute's favourites, Sazza. A True Soul.
Sazza: Nah. Can't be... they woz in the grove, hangin' around with the tieflin's.
Nightwarden Minthara: Undercover, no doubt. Carrying out the Absolute's will. Oh, Sazza - you have made a grave error.
Nightwarden Minthara: And it will be your last. My spiders are hungry, little one...
Nightwarden Minthara: ...but before they feast, tell me where that grove is, and I may yet spare your life.
Sazza: It's past the bridge, to the east! Big ol' gate, covered in ivy! Don't hurt me, mistress. Please!
Nightwarden Minthara: I will not hurt you. My spiders will have that pleasure.
Sazza: No! I mucked up, I'm sorry! But I didn't know who they woz... they didn't tell me nothin'!
Player: You only have to look at me to know I'm your superior, wretch.
Sazza: Somebody help!
Nightwarden Minthara: Through sheer luck, that pathetic worm has brought me the information I need.
Nightwarden Minthara: And it seems that the inhabitants of the grove trust you - we can use that against them.
Nightwarden Minthara: You have a part to play in this slaughter.
Nightwarden Minthara: Return to the grove. When my raiding party approaches, throw open the gate and signal me.
Narrator: *The fate of the grove's inhabitants hangs in the balance.*
Narrator: *Killing the drow here would spare them, but it might be better to face her warband at the grove itself, on familiar ground.*
Narrator: *On the other hand, participating in the slaughter as she asks may be the perfect way to earn her trust, and access to the cult's inner circle.*
Player: I'll get it done.

Isobel: On with you. Unless you want to come back to a gaggle of shadow-cursed Harpers.
Player: My blood... it's telling me to kill you.
Isobel: And yet you hesitate.
Narrator: *She doesn't believe you will do it. You can see, she wants to believe there is mercy in all, even in the worst.*
Isobel: You aren't the first to threaten me. But I know the eyes of a killer when I see them. You mean me no harm. Do you? An experienced cleric can tell such things.
Narrator: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*
Player: BASH YOU! EAT YOU! FLAY! FLAY!

Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
Counsellor Florrick: Wyll, by the living gods! I couldn't have asked for a finer saviour.
Narrator: *She is a ghost from your past come to haunt you - Counsellor Florrick, your father's closest confidante, and a loyal servant of Baldur's Gate.*
Counsellor Florrick: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Pavel.
Counsellor Florrick: Now listen close, fist: duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.
Counsellor Florrick: Ito - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Counsellor Florrick: Gauntlet - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Fist Recruit Ito: On your command, Counsellor.
Counsellor Florrick: The rest of you - count the dead. Take word of their sacrifice to the city.
Counsellor Florrick: And you - I must ask again for your aid.
Counsellor Florrick: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.
Counsellor Florrick: May I trust you'll see it through?
Player: You'll have to find somebody else for the job.

Lord Enver Gortash: Always.
Lord Enver Gortash: Oh, yes - we've much to discuss. But first, come and be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.
Player: Let the ceremony begin. I wouldn't dream of missing it.
Lord Enver Gortash: Then we proceed. The patriars await.
Lord Enver Gortash: Distinguished dukes, patriars. Dearest Ravengard - I will heed your call. A new chapter begins.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Gortash approaches Ravengard. Ravengard nods and steps forward. He holds a sword aloft - the sword of Balduran, perhaps. Gortash kneels, back to player. Everyone takes position for the Archduke ceremony.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Enver Gortash. Swearest thou, by Balduran's blade, to defend the citizens of Baldur's Gate from enemies within and without?
Lord Enver Gortash: I swear.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Swearest thou true faith and fealty to the same, by word, deed, and decree, so that none may suffer?
Lord Enver Gortash: I swear.
NodeContext: Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Gathered guests, grant ye consent?
Player: Father. No!
Lord Enver Gortash: The young Ravengard is with the Absolute. He means to disrupt this council.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A traitor's words - they mean to fracture this Council!
Lord Enver Gortash: Patriars - let it be known. The War of the Absolute has begun.

Nightwarden Minthara: It is time for the raid to begin. The grove, and those who are hiding there, will fall.
Nightwarden Minthara: Go to their refuge and make your way inside. As a friend.

Sergeant Thrinn: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.
Sergeant Thrinn: Listen, you pricks. Grab your gear and get ready to move.
NodeContext: Addressed to the room in general
Sergeant Thrinn: I'm going to Moonrise. And that death-curse won't be stopping me.
Sergeant Thrinn: It's time I met the General in the flesh.
Player: What about the slaves? What happens to them?
Sergeant Thrinn: What else? They're coming with us. A gift to the General from his new faithful.
Wyll: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.
Narrator: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
Player: FREE THEM, OR ELSE.
: True
Sergeant Thrinn: Fine. I'm in no mood to butt heads with another True Soul.
Sergeant Thrinn: Get out of here, squat-pricks - before I toss you all in the fires.

Player: Good idea. They will make a fine offering.

GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
Player: What I want is Mayrina - alive and free.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: But she's worthless to you!
Mayrina: Don't let her take me. Please.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Shut it. You owe me a babe, girl. And I'll take it - whether you like it or not.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Let me leave with the girl, and I'll give you power.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: You want to be stronger? Tougher? Smarter? Done! Anything is possible. (Ability Score +1)
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: Just let me keep the girl and her babe.
Wyll: Don't you dare take the offer. No power is worth such a cruel price.
GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag: It's your choice, sweetness.
Player: Such power will let me better serve the Spider Queen. Give it to me.
Player: Keep the girl. I'll take the power.

Counsellor Florrick: You're too late.
Counsellor Florrick: It's over.
Wyll: By Avernus - Florrick.
Counsellor Florrick: Wyll? Is that you? What curse has befallen you?
Counsellor Florrick: No matter. The city, the future. It's done.
Player: So you're giving up, just like that?
Counsellor Florrick: I didn't give up. I lost.
Counsellor Florrick: I came seeking allies to our cause. Watchers spotted me, dragged me to Ulder Ravengard's husk.
Counsellor Florrick: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.
Counsellor Florrick: Empty as a stare. A tadpole's puppet, nothing more.
Counsellor Florrick: He spoke in accusations. Apostasy, conspiracy, sedition.
Counsellor Florrick: I will soon be hanged on the city gallows to a chorus of cheers.
Counsellor Florrick: You might have unlocked my cell, but there's no escape from this place.
Wyll: Father is safe, Florrick. He is freed from the grip of the Absolute.
Counsellor Florrick: Then - then there is hope yet. To think I'd all but given up.
Counsellor Florrick: No more sulking. I know what to do.
Counsellor Florrick: Lead me from my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.
Counsellor Florrick: I'll seek out my connections. When the city's streets shatter, you'll want their blades.
Player: I won't help you.

Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

Isobel: And yet you hesitate.
Narrator: *She doesn't believe you will do it. You can see, she wants to believe there is mercy in all, even in the worst.*
Isobel: You aren't the first to threaten me. But I know the eyes of a killer when I see them. You mean me no harm. Do you? An experienced cleric can tell such things.
Narrator: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*
Player: Chase away your putrid desires.
Narrator: *As suddenly as it started, you have tamed the Urge. It slumbers again.*
Isobel: There we are. The real you. Your - affliction, is it? - doesn't rule you, does it.
Player: I'm not going to follow my order. You will live.
Isobel: Why don't we try again, then? Who are you?
Isobel: Hold - who are you, and what are you doing here?
Narrator: *Your body yearns to kill this cleric, more than anything else. You know it, deep down, in your writhing intestines.*
Player: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I mean you no harm.
Isobel: You'd be a bit late to the party if you did. Ketheric Thorm done for. Or didn't you see that angel carving a path straight toward Moonrise Towers?
Player: Attack her. The Urge aches for it.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Hide Marcus
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is already in her room.
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
InternalNodeContext: The ritual was disturbed and Isobel is already in the room (dialogue was interrupted, someone yanked her into the room, etc.)
Isobel: You're here for the protection spell, right? Come on - let's get you fit for purpose.
Player: Try to understand what's happening.
Narrator: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
Isobel: Well! If the Moonmaiden didn't strike me dead for blessing you, she must rather approve of this little alliance.
Isobel: This will block the lesser effects of the shadow curse, allowing you to traverse the darkness outside... should Shar's own protection falter, that is.
Isobel: Curious. Surely the Nightsinger could have shielded all her followers, and made this place her domain long ago... yet she only acts now, and aids you alone. I wonder why.
Player: That's none of your concern.
Isobel: I suppose you're right.

Player: You're coming with me, cleric.

Lord Enver Gortash: Always.
Lord Enver Gortash: You know, it takes all three to control the brain. Without Thorm's, it's become vexingly wilful.
Lord Enver Gortash: The quakes are a clear warning. If nobody steps in soon, it'll free itself from the authority of the crown.
Lord Enver Gortash: I expect it'll start with turning the Sword Coast's infected - you among them. That Prism of yours won't last indefinitely.
Lord Enver Gortash: Next, the Grand Design. The mind flayer empire reborn. If we're lucky, we'll become slaves. If we're unlucky, well -
Lord Enver Gortash: A bleak prospect. But it's a fate that can be avoided if you and I renew our old partnership.
Lord Enver Gortash: Not the most thrilling of prospects. But it's a fate that can be avoided if you and I come to an understanding.
Lord Enver Gortash: You may have wrought the destruction of my Iron Throne - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.
Lord Enver Gortash: Together we can still restore authority over the brain.

Isobel: Don't let Jaheira catch you dawdling.

Player: My blood... it's telling me to kill you.

Narrator: *She doesn't believe you will do it. You can see, she wants to believe there is mercy in all, even in the worst.*
Isobel: You aren't the first to threaten me. But I know the eyes of a killer when I see them. You mean me no harm. Do you? An experienced cleric can tell such things.
Narrator: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*
Player: Chase away your putrid desires.
Narrator: *As suddenly as it started, you have tamed the Urge. It slumbers again.*

Player: I'm cursed with spells of madness, forgive me what I said.
Isobel: Why don't we try again, then? Who are you?
Isobel: Hold - who are you, and what are you doing here?
Narrator: *Your body yearns to kill this cleric, more than anything else. You know it, deep down, in your writhing intestines.*

Isobel: You'd be a bit late to the party if you did. Ketheric Thorm done for. Or didn't you see that angel carving a path straight toward Moonrise Towers?
Player: Forsake your truce. Kill her.

Nightwarden Minthara: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.
Nightwarden Minthara: It is time for the raid to begin. The grove, and those who are hiding there, will fall.
Nightwarden Minthara: Go to their refuge and make your way inside. As a friend.

Nightwarden Minthara: I will gather a raiding party and move into position.
Nightwarden Minthara: You will open the gates from the inside when the time is right to strike.
Nightwarden Minthara: We will cleanse the place of infidels and burn it to the ground in the Absolute's name.
Nightwarden Minthara: And then we will be the first among Her favourites.

Sarevok Anchev: You gaze upon Murder's progeny, child.
Echo of Amelyssan: His most ill-trusted zealots.
Echo of Sendai: HIS FAITHFUL DEPARTED.
Echo of Illasera: Prodigal servants, each returned to do his bidding eternally.
Narrator: *In years past you brought this man low - foiled his plot to become a god. Now you stand before him, once again. Sarevok Anchev.*
Sarevok Anchev: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.
Sarevok Anchev: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.
Jaheira: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.
Sarevok Anchev: You disappoint me, child of Murder. I expected more of your return.
Narrator: *The history they share may be long gone, but the threat of violence between them is as fresh as newly spilled blood - neither party will let the other walk out of here alive.*
Sarevok Anchev: What purpose do you have in bringing these heretics to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.
Player: We're not here to dig up old feuds. I seek a path to the Temple of Bhaal.
Sarevok Anchev: You speak of the past - I speak of the future. Well, aspirant? Do the shades of yesterday speak for you, too?
Sarevok Anchev: There are two paths to the Temple of Bhaal: to carve your devotion into flesh, or to be the carcass that is carved upon.
Player: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Minsc answers to me. He won't be a problem.

Sarevok Anchev: It seems there is some disagreement on who is master here.
Player: Fine, Sarevok. If he won't obey - take him as my offering instead.

Sceleritas Fel: Master. You are the chosen one.
NodeContext: Awestruck
Sceleritas Fel: He is near... He comes for you.
NodeContext: Butler's body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. [description] CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge walks toward the pool of blood, peering down at the Avatar of Bhaal within
Bhaal Avatar: I expected the other.
Bhaal Avatar: But you live, and her blood is returned to me. You are my Chosen.
Bhaal Avatar: I have a gift for you, Child. You will use it to lacerate this world.
Narrator: *A gift from your god, your Father. An offering of his affection for you, or confirmation that he owns you.*
Narrator: *Accept Father's gift and you will reap horrors upon this world. But you will be his puppet. This is your final chance to cut your strings...*
GROUP_ORI_DU: Bow your head.
GROUP_ORI_DU: What gift does the Lord of Murder propose?
Bhaal Avatar: My Slayer. You will grow stronger. Crueller. The prime incarnation of murder.
GROUP_ORI_DU: What would you have me do with this gift?
Bhaal Avatar: Domination. Slaughter. Mountains of corpses, you standing atop them.
Bhaal Avatar: You must destroy this world. It is what you were made for.
Narrator: *For a moment, the brine-pool of your brain clears. To die: to rest, to save the world from yourself. To accept: to become his prophet - in any disobedience, subject to his lash.*
GROUP_ORI_DU: I've defied you before. You cannot force me to do this.
Bhaal Avatar: You refuse me?
Bhaal Avatar: You are my spawn. Your veins course with my unholy blood.
Bhaal Avatar: Your life is mine. Accept your inheritance, or I will reclaim it.
GROUP_ORI_DU: My apologies, Father. Of course I accept.

NodeContext: Butler's body beginning to vibrate, and jerk strangely
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

Narrator: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*
Player: Chase away your putrid desires.
Narrator: *As suddenly as it started, you have tamed the Urge. It slumbers again.*

Isobel: Why don't we try again, then? Who are you?
Isobel: Hold - who are you, and what are you doing here?

Player: Attack her. The Urge aches for it.

Sarevok Anchev: You gaze upon Murder's progeny, child.
Echo of Amelyssan: His most ill-trusted zealots.
Echo of Sendai: HIS FAITHFUL DEPARTED.
Echo of Illasera: Prodigal servants, each returned to do his bidding eternally.
Narrator: *In years past you brought this man low - foiled his plot to become a god. Now you stand before him, once again. Sarevok Anchev.*
Sarevok Anchev: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.
Sarevok Anchev: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.
Jaheira: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.
Sarevok Anchev: You disappoint me, child of Murder. I expected more of your return.
Narrator: *The history they share may be long gone, but the threat of violence between them is as fresh as newly spilled blood - neither party will let the other walk out of here alive.*
Sarevok Anchev: What purpose do you have in bringing these heretics to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.
Player: We're not here to dig up old feuds. I seek a path to the Temple of Bhaal.
Minsc: Let us pave our own path. Starting with the kicked buttocks of that one there.
Minsc: Sarevok once had his chance to taste of goodness - but he spat it back out. Now he may taste boot-leather instead.
Sarevok Anchev: You speak of the past - I speak of the future. Well, aspirant? Do the shades of yesterday speak for you, too?
Sarevok Anchev: There are two paths to the Temple of Bhaal: to carve your devotion into flesh, or to be the carcass that is carved upon.
Player: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Jaheira answers to me. She won't be a problem.
Jaheira: You make promises that aren't yours to keep. Take care that their breaking does not break something more.
Minsc: If Minsc is certain of one thing, it is that he very much plans on being a problem for Sarevok.
Sarevok Anchev: I know these two well. I have travelled in their company. Whatever else may be said of them, they answer to no one but themselves.
Sarevok Anchev: It seems there is some disagreement on who is master here.
Player: Fine, Sarevok. If she won't obey - take her as my offering instead.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge walks toward the pool of blood, peering down at the Avatar of Bhaal within
Bhaal Avatar: Child of slaughter. I come to give you your inheritance.
Bhaal Avatar: I have a gift for you, Child. You will use it to lacerate this world.
Narrator: *A gift from your god, your Father. An offering of his affection for you, or confirmation that he owns you.*
Narrator: *Accept Father's gift and you will reap horrors upon this world. But you will be his puppet. This is your final chance to cut your strings...*
GROUP_ORI_DU: Bow your head.
GROUP_ORI_DU: What gift does the Lord of Murder propose?
Bhaal Avatar: My Slayer. You will grow stronger. Crueller. The prime incarnation of murder.
GROUP_ORI_DU: I have no need of such a power.
Bhaal Avatar: Arrogance.
Bhaal Avatar: You refuse me?
Bhaal Avatar: You are my spawn. Your veins course with my unholy blood.
Bhaal Avatar: Your life is mine. Accept your inheritance, or I will reclaim it.
GROUP_ORI_DU: I don't have a choice, it seems. This is what I am.

Elder Brithvar: Freeze it, cock-stench. We aren't done just yet.
Elder Brithvar: Nere and his Absolute wanks owed us a wad of coin. And the dregs on his corpse aren't gonna cut it.
Elder Brithvar: Pay up, and you get to slink away. Resist, and I gut you. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Player: You've got this all wrong. I pay you nothing, and you keep your head.
: True
Elder Brithvar: Drugnin' jargh. Have it your way.
Elder Brithvar: Clan: grab your gear, wipe your arses.
NodeContext: Addressed to the room in general
Elder Brithvar: Time I scrammed before more pricks from Moonrise Towers move in.
Player: And the slaves? What about them?
Elder Brithvar: Clan property. They come with us.
Gale: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.
Player: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

Counsellor Florrick: Leave me. It's over.
Player: Calm down, this cell was trivial to unlock. Getting out of here will be easy.
Counsellor Florrick: You don't get it. We lost.
Counsellor Florrick: I came seeking allies to our cause. Watchers spotted me, dragged me to Ulder Ravengard's husk.
Counsellor Florrick: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.
Counsellor Florrick: Empty as a stare. A tadpole's puppet, nothing more.
Counsellor Florrick: He spoke in accusations. Apostasy, conspiracy, sedition.
Counsellor Florrick: I will soon be hanged on the city gallows to a chorus of cheers.
Counsellor Florrick: You might have unlocked my cell, but there's no escape from this place.
Wyll: The Hells with that. Nothing is over. Not while I still draw breath.
Player: Pathetic. I'm getting you out so I can beat some sense into you.
: True
Counsellor Florrick: Heh - I'll give you credit. I'm drowning in tears, and you hold out a fist. Ulder would've done the same.
Counsellor Florrick: 'When the people need a miracle', he said, 'you cannot wait for the gods to answer.' I'd almost forgotten.
Counsellor Florrick: No more sulking. I know what to do.
Counsellor Florrick: Lead me from my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.
Counsellor Florrick: I'll seek out my connections. When the city's streets shatter, you'll want their blades.
Player: I won't help you.

Counsellor Florrick: Wyll? What has become of you?
Player: So you're giving up, just like that?
Counsellor Florrick: I didn't give up. I lost.
Counsellor Florrick: I came seeking allies to our cause. Watchers spotted me, dragged me to Ulder Ravengard's husk.
Counsellor Florrick: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.
Counsellor Florrick: Empty as a stare. A tadpole's puppet, nothing more.
Counsellor Florrick: He spoke in accusations. Apostasy, conspiracy, sedition.
Counsellor Florrick: I'll be executed in five dawns.
Counsellor Florrick: You might have unlocked my cell, but there's no escape from this place.
Wyll: The Hells with that. Nothing is over. Not while I still draw breath.
Player: I'm breaking you out. Baldur's Gate needs you. Ravengard needs you.
: True
Player: Gorion's Ward overcame great odds to protect the city. You can do the same.
Counsellor Florrick: 'When the people need a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.' Ulder's words. I'd almost forgotten.
Counsellor Florrick: No more sulking. I know what to do.
Counsellor Florrick: Lead me from my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.
Counsellor Florrick: I'll seek out my connections. When the city's streets shatter, you'll want their blades.
Player: I won't help you.

Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
Counsellor Florrick: Wyll, by the living gods! I couldn't have asked for a finer saviour.
Narrator: *She is a ghost from your past come to haunt you - Counsellor Florrick, your father's closest confidante, and a loyal servant of Baldur's Gate.*
Counsellor Florrick: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Aelis.
Counsellor Florrick: Now listen close, fist: duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.
Counsellor Florrick: Pavel - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Counsellor Florrick: Gauntlet - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.
Fist Recruit Pavel: On your command, Counsellor.
Counsellor Florrick: The rest of you - count the dead. Take word of their sacrifice to the city.
Counsellor Florrick: And you - I must ask again for your aid.
Counsellor Florrick: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.
Counsellor Florrick: May I trust you'll see it through?
Player: Goblins take their prisoners to Moonrise Towers. That's where we'll find the duke.
Counsellor Florrick: Moonrise Towers? Along the old road? That place is cursed. Few could survive there...
Counsellor Florrick: ... unless darker forces are at work.
Counsellor Florrick: This was no random attack. The Grand Duke was their target.
Player: You'll need to find him without my help - I've done all I can for now.

Wyll: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
Counsellor Florrick: Thank you so - no, it can't be. Wyll, by the living gods, what's happened to you?
Player: Let's just say I got mixed up with the wrong crowd.
Counsellor Florrick: Yes. As Ravengard told me, where his son treads, the Hells fires are sure to burn.
Narrator: *She is a ghost from your past come to haunt you - Counsellor Florrick, your father's closest confidante, and a loyal servant of Baldur's Gate.*

Isobel: On with you. Unless you want to come back to a gaggle of shadow-cursed Harpers.
Player: I won't let that happen.
Isobel: I know you won't.
Isobel: Don't let Jaheira catch you dawdling.
Narrator: *There is something about her... it would be wonderful to kill her. A perfect tragedy.*
Player: My blood... it's telling me to kill you.
Isobel: And yet you hesitate.
Narrator: *She doesn't believe you will do it. You can see, she wants to believe there is mercy in all, even in the worst.*
Isobel: You aren't the first to threaten me. But I know the eyes of a killer when I see them. You mean me no harm. Do you? An experienced cleric can tell such things.
Narrator: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*
Player: Your blood is my offering, my oblation, my gift.

Sazza: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.
Nightwarden Minthara: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?
Sazza: They woz in some rickety druid grove! Mostly full of tieflin's, but them intruders you're after were hidin' out there!
Nightwarden Minthara: I presume you dealt with my prey, and massacred the rest?
Sazza: Ah... well, the thing about that is... they sorta massacred us.
Sazza: I got myself nabbed though; ended up all snug in a cage instead of smashed. I'm wily like that.
Sazza: And then the Absolute answered my prayers - sent a True Soul to save me!
Nightwarden Minthara: You are a True Soul.
Nightwarden Minthara: And it seems that the inhabitants of the grove trust you - we can use that against them.
Nightwarden Minthara: You have a part to play in this slaughter.
Nightwarden Minthara: Return to the grove. When my raiding party approaches, throw open the gate and signal me.
Narrator: *The fate of the grove's inhabitants hangs in the balance.*
Narrator: *Killing the drow here would spare them, but it might be better to face her warband at the grove itself, on familiar ground.*
Narrator: *On the other hand, participating in the slaughter as she asks may be the perfect way to earn her trust, and access to the cult's inner circle.*
Player: I want no part of this.
Nightwarden Minthara: I do not intend to lead a suicidal charge. The goblins are expendable; I am not.
Nightwarden Minthara: The Absolute brought you here for a reason - to throw open those gates and crush our enemies.
Player: All right. Expect me at the grove.

Counsellor Florrick: Leave me. It's over.
Player: Oh, don't be dramatic. I could unlock this cell blindfolded - you'll be out in no time.
Counsellor Florrick: You don't get it. We lost.

Nightwarden Minthara: The goblins tell me that you extracted a confession from our prisoner, True Soul.
Nightwarden Minthara: Without your help, they would have extracted nothing but screams and blood.
Narrator: *Her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
Nightwarden Minthara: You are a True Soul, sister? It is good to have your assistance.
Nightwarden Minthara: It is time for the raid to begin. The grove, and those who are hiding there, will fall.
Nightwarden Minthara: Go to their refuge and make your way inside. As a friend.
Player: They'll die thinking I'm their hero.
Nightwarden Minthara: Exquisite. The Absolute chose well when She chose you.
Nightwarden Minthara: I will gather a raiding party and move into position.
Nightwarden Minthara: You will open the gates from the inside when the time is right to strike.
Nightwarden Minthara: We will cleanse the place of infidels and burn it to the ground in the Absolute's name.
Nightwarden Minthara: And then we will be the first among Her favourites.
Narrator: *The masterful painting she depicts of the massacre awakens you hungrily.*
Player: Reject these dreams of a bloodbath.
Nightwarden Minthara: The Absolute brought you here for a reason - to throw open those gates so we can crush our enemies.
Player: You're right. I'll see you at the grove.

Sarevok Anchev: You gaze upon Murder's progeny, child.
Echo of Amelyssan: His most ill-trusted zealots.
Echo of Sendai: HIS FAITHFUL DEPARTED.
Echo of Illasera: Prodigal servants, each returned to do his bidding eternally.
Narrator: *In years past you brought this man low - foiled his plot to become a god. Now you stand before him, once again. Sarevok Anchev.*
Sarevok Anchev: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.
Sarevok Anchev: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.
Jaheira: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.
Sarevok Anchev: You disappoint me, child of Murder. I expected more of your return.
Narrator: *The history they share may be long gone, but the threat of violence between them is as fresh as newly spilled blood - neither party will let the other walk out of here alive.*
Sarevok Anchev: What purpose do you have in bringing these heretics to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.
Player: We're not here to dig up old feuds. I seek a path to the Temple of Bhaal.
Jaheira: Do not parley with this madman.
Jaheira: Sarevok reclaimed his soul, once - and he still traded it back to his father for a pat on the head. He has earned his second death even more than his first.
Sarevok Anchev: You speak of the past - I speak of the future. Well, aspirant? Do the shades of yesterday speak for you, too?
Sarevok Anchev: There are two paths to the Temple of Bhaal: to carve your devotion into flesh, or to be the carcass that is carved upon.
Player: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Jaheira answers to me. She won't be a problem.
Jaheira: You make promises that aren't yours to keep. Take care that their breaking does not break something more.
Minsc: If Minsc is certain of one thing, it is that he very much plans on being a problem for Sarevok.
Sarevok Anchev: I know these two well. I have travelled in their company. Whatever else may be said of them, they answer to no one but themselves.
Sarevok Anchev: It seems there is some disagreement on who is master here.
Player: Fine, Sarevok. If he won't obey - take him as my offering instead.

Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

Narrator: *In years past you brought this man low - foiled his plot to become a god. Now you stand before him, once again. Sarevok Anchev.*
Sarevok Anchev: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.
Sarevok Anchev: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.

Sarevok Anchev: You disappoint me, child of Murder. I expected more of your return.
Narrator: *The history they share may be long gone, but the threat of violence between them is as fresh as newly spilled blood - neither party will let the other walk out of here alive.*
Sarevok Anchev: What purpose do you have in bringing these heretics to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.
Player: We're not here to dig up old feuds. I seek a path to the Temple of Bhaal.

Minsc: Sarevok once had his chance to taste of goodness - but he spat it back out. Now he may taste boot-leather instead.

Sarevok Anchev: There are two paths to the Temple of Bhaal: to carve your devotion into flesh, or to be the carcass that is carved upon.

Jaheira: You make promises that aren't yours to keep. Take care that their breaking does not break something more.
Minsc: If Minsc is certain of one thing, it is that he very much plans on being a problem for Sarevok.
Sarevok Anchev: I know this one well. I have travelled in his company. Whatever else may be said of him, he answers to no one but Boo.
Sarevok Anchev: It seems there is some disagreement on who is master here.
Player: Fine, Sarevok. If he won't obey - take him as my offering instead.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The butler levitates, held up in the air like a broken marionette on invisible strings. Daggers manifest in the air around him and plunge into his body, making a gory pincusion of him. His mutilated corpse crashes to the ground, and the blood that runs from it forms a dark pool.

A light glows within the pool, and within the reflection, we see the Bhaal Temple - the eyes of the skull light with flame within the reflection, and a figure moves out of the darkness toward the surface of the pool, where it connects to reality. It is the butler, his hat gone, the flesh peeled back from his skull in places. Thoroughly mutilated and disfigured. His eyes burn with unholy fire - he has become an Avatar of Bhaal.

Alfira: First cultists nearly murder us, and now we have a traitor on the inside? Can't we trust anyone?
NodeContext: frustrated and tired of being scared

Alfira: We were ambushed out in the darkness - by cultists. We surrendered, but that wasn't enough for them.

Alfira: Maybe that's why they picked him. Told him to kneel...
Alfira: They took his eyes first. Then his tongue.
Player: Wandering into the darkness was a stupid idea.
Alfira: And I regret it with every breath.
Alfira: I had to watch my friends, people who can barely hold a sword, try to fight a pack of murderous zealots.
Alfira: All I could do was run.
Player: What did the cultists do to the others?
Alfira: I don't know. It just... happened so quickly.
Alfira: How do you do it? How do you keep going?
Player: I'll let you know when I figure it out.

Alfira: You've done so much for us already, but I have to ask - the others might still be out there.
Alfira: If they're not dead, they're in Moonrise. And gods have mercy on anyone in that hellspit.
Player: I imagine the cultists are torturing them right now.

Klaus: Benji here checks all our patrons to make sure none of you are vicious murderers. Can't be too careful!
Klaus: Hello, hello, and welcome to the Circus of the Last Days - the finest extraplanar circus there is!

GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: Hail, friend. Fine day, isn't it?

Player: My home is somewhere. I must live here.

GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: Used to be you'd arrive knowing you'd a full belly and a warm bed waiting for you. Not any more.
GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: These days, there's barely enough to go around. Add the refugees on top and... well, folk aren't feeling too generous.
Player: Sounds like that's your problem, not mine.
GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: If it were my problem, I'd do something about it. Instead they've stuck me guarding this door while they squabble over the donations.
GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: Some well-to-do's in the city donated enough to see the newcomers right for the time being. Only they didn't bother helping everyone else.
GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: Locals going without while strangers feast - it's stoked the fire, all right. Some Baldurians are kicking up a fuss round the front of the barn as we speak.
GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist: If I wasn't wearing this uniform, I'd walk round there and teach them a lesson they'd never forget.

Fist Marcus: My old friend. Very good to see you again.

Fist Marcus: But that's not my problem. The Absolute chose me to bring glory to this place. The General must have sent you, too.
Fist Marcus: I don't mind sharing the rewards.

Fist Marcus: Without her, everyone here - everyone scheming against General Ketheric - is done for.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel is standing on the balcony, bathed in a beam of moonlight piercing the darkness. Her hands are in a prayer position and she's chanting softly as the moonlight dances around her. She exhales, then inhales and breaths in tendrils of shadow, absorbing them. She swallows, then begins hacking coughing. The moonlight dissipates. She quickly goes from seeming like a divine spirit to a normal young woman.
Isobel: I didn't realise I had an audience.
Fist Marcus: Isobel. This is -
Isobel: The True Soul who's going to save us all. Pleased to meet you.

Isobel: We've been waiting - hoping against hope - for someone like you.
Isobel: Free from the Absolute's influence, yet able to walk among cultists.
Isobel: It's almost too good to be true. But I'd be a poor cleric indeed not to avail of a blessing when I see one.
Isobel: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.
